arm_group.description: Fist group treated with clarithromycin which is include 10 days application.
Second group treated with salin as same as amount of clarithromycine volume

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to determine of clarithromycin effect on developing of
      bronchopulmonary dysplasia  in preterm babies.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clarithromycin Prophylaxis in Preterm Infants Colonisation With Ureaplasma Urealyticum and Mycoplasma Hominis

detailed_description.textblock:
The investigators planned that clarithromycin treatment in preterm babies who are under 1250
      grams birth weight.

      The investigators aimed with this treatment, the  bronchopulmonary dysplasia rate of preterm
      babies may decrease.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  all infant must be under 1250 gram birth weight

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Major congenital anomaly,

          -  CardiaC abnormality,

          -  without inform consent

intervention.intervention_name: clarithromycin treatment for prophylaxis of bronchopulmonary dysplasia

facility.name: Zekai Tahir Burak Maternity Teaching Hospital

clinical_study.official_title: Prophylaxis of Bronchopulmonary Dysplasia With Clarithromycin

overall_official.affiliation: Zekai Tahir Burak Maternity and Teaching Hospital

primary_outcome.description: On the 28. day of birth, The investigator will determine the baby whether has developed bronchopulmonary dysplasia

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Zekai Tahir Burak Maternity and Teaching Hospital

secondary_outcome.description: During to hospitalisation the investigator will determine and record some co-morbidities of BPD such as intracranial hemorrhage, necrotizing enterocolitis, patent ductus arteriosus rates.From date of randomization until the end of the hospitalisation up to the 3 months of life.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Participants will be followed for the duration of hospital stay, an expected average of postnatal 40 weeks

clinical_study.source: Zekai Tahir Burak Maternity and Teaching Hospital

lead_sponsor.agency: Zekai Tahir Burak Maternity and Teaching Hospital

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Crossover Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Caregiver), Primary Purpose: Prevention
